newsitem.title: USA: NYCE cotton called to open flat to up 0.10 cent.
newsitem.headline: NYCE cotton called to open flat to up 0.10 cent.

text.p: NYCE cotton futures were called to open flat to 0.10 cent firmer Friday, based on market orders at 1020 EDT, dealers said.
Thursday, the July cotton contract closed 0.26 cent lower at 73.38 cents per lb after trading from 73.90 to 73.30 cents. New-crop December went out 0.04 cent firmer at 76.19 cents.
An estimated 20,000 lots changed hands on the day.
Resistance remained at Thursday's high of 73.90 cents in July, also a high reached on June 2. Firmer resistance stands at 74.10 cents, where traders expect to uncover buy stops.
